items.title: crashes while using VST2 plugins v 1.7.0 + 1.7.1
items.body:
thank you for your work on the sparta vsts.  ive been using the plugins before the update to 1.7 a lot with no issues.  

after the update, most if not all the vst2s have been crashing my reaper and i had to revert back to 1.6.2.  i tried the 1.7.1 update and they still crash almost instantly, sometimes with a 30 sec delay

im using a 64 bit windows machine.  if you would like any more specifics please let me know.

items.title: Matrix Conv and Multi Conv Glitching
items.body:
I’m trying to implement matrix and multi Conv internal functions (the base functions used in the examples, not the examples themselves), but noticed that I get some glitching every so often. I notice this especially if I use a buffer size less than 512 samples.

Are there buffer size requirements to use these functions? Is there anything that comes to mind that could cause this glitching?

items.title: The automations are not recorded when the source is moved in the GUI
items.body:
Hello dear SPARTA developers.

I testet your plugins on Windows 10 x64 and 11 with Reaper ( and Ardour ). I like your plugin, because the sound quality is great.

But, on both systems, with the VST, VST3 and LV2 SPARTA Plugin, is the same issue.
The automations are not recorded when the source is moved in the Plugin-GUI. This seems to be a bug in the plugin and not in Reaper, because it behaves identically in Ardour. And other Plugins, f.e. IEM RoomEncoder are working fine.

I made a video of it and attached it.

SPARTA AmbiRoomSim ( doesn't work )
https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/assets/150351395/7e1e45f4-d939-442d-90a9-c551400316c5

IEM RoomEncoder ( works perfectly )
https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/assets/150351395/19e8ff64-95a0-47a9-8333-e424c1eee668

Is there a solution how to get the sparta plugins to work?

BR
Andreas

This problem seems to be exist since 2021.
https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/issues/44

items.title: VST3 plugins don't detect channel counts over 64
items.body: In Reaper running on my Windows machine, the VST3 versions are not detecting the 128 channels Reaper is providing, but are still showing me the message that the channel count needs to be higher. 7. Order is working still fine and VST2 version also up to 10. Order.

items.title: Powermap, DirASS, and SLDoA plugins will crash on MacOS if a camera is selected while hosting the plugins on a "Runtime Hardened" DAW
items.body:
I don't see a way around this. If REAPER (or any other run-time hardened DAW) doesn't present the user with the option to enable it to have "Camera" access, then this crash is inevitable: 

> 2024-01-30 14:17:49.282736+0200 REAPER[2004:35811] [access] This app has crashed because it has a hardened runtime and attempted to access privacy-sensitive data without an entitlement indicating its intent to access this data.  The app must have the 'com.apple.security.device.camera' entitlement.

However, since an acoustic camera (see: [for example](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NoeEXCoriE4)) is quite a niche use case for an audio plugin, I think it would be unlikely that the REAPER devs would present this request to their users.

In previous versions of MacOS, the user could force/manually add permissions for an app to use the camera. However, as of 11.0+ it seems like this is no longer the case. 

Therefore, unless REAPER decides to request Camera access for these niche use cases, or Apple allows its users to decide these things for themselves, or we remove this feature from the plugins, then this crash is unavoidable. 

Unless someone has any other ideas?

items.title: Sparta Binuralizer crashes in adobe audition 2020.
items.body:
I have a bunch of old multichannel audio recordings I would like to try to listen to using some of the more modern stereo headphone spatializer techniques.

When I try loading the binuralizer plugin says Resampling the HRIR's.  Shows middling cpu activity on a few of my cores then eventually crashes.  This is pretty odd behavior for a VST plugin.

I thought it might be because I was trying to load it on 88kHz sample rate wav files, but I also tried it on 48Khz wav files to the same result.

Any idea if there is a fix, the entire program is essentially non responsive as soon as I load the plugin.

Also why not support higher sample rates?

items.title: SPARTA 6DoF conv: OSC and VST parameters, scene view, SOFA files
items.body:
These modifications are targeted to improve the "SPARTA 6DoF conv" plugin.
Main changes:
- OSC messages and parameters:
    - added missing items and bug fixes
- scene view:
    - X/Y axis swapped
    - refresh/repaint optimization
    - room grid improved
- SOFA files:
    - file loading/status displayed on the GUI
    - Added notification to host (using parameters output) about the room size when a sofa file is loaded or reloaded

items.title: compass_tracker parameters not moving/updating in Ableton Live
items.body: I know Live isn't a recommended DAW for ambisonics, however it is possible to route multiple tracks into a multichannel VST plugin in Live. I have a project where I'd ideally like to control other device parameters in Live via input from an ambisonic mic (e.g. Azi/Elev parameters of tracked signals). I can get compass_tracker to run properly in Live via this track routing method, but the Target Azi/Elev parameters don't move in response to the tracked signal.

items.title: Sparta Plugins don't work on Macbook Pro M1 on Ventura - DAW Logic X Pro
items.body:
Hello, I have successfully downloaded your VST3 plugins for Mac Os Arm-x86, and the installation process went smoothly. 
All the plugins are in the correct folder, where all the other working plugins for Logic are also located. 
When I launch Logic X Pro, unlike when I install a new plugin, the window for scanning new plugins does not appear. 
It simply ignores them.
I've checked in the plugin manager, and your plugins do not appear at all.
I've tried forcing a reset of the audio unit and performing a complete rescan, but... nothing.
Just to clarify: it's not that the plugins are present in the plugin manager and marked as incompatible. 
They are simply not there.

Macbook Pro M1
macOS 13.5.1 
Logic 10.7.9

I'm very interested in trying out your plugins; can you help me figure this out?
Thanks in advance,
Paolo

items.title: macOS Package Receipt
items.body:
Hi, @leomccormack 

We're looking to deploy SPARTA to some of our education customers. 

We have an issue where we can't deploy SPARTA without repackaging it. The tooling we use to automatically download and install (AutoPkg, Munki, Jamf Pro) needs a way to know that the version has been updated, and to install that latest version. One common way is looking at package receipts for this. 

Would it be possible for you to bump the package receipt version number when you release a new version so that they match? Currently the package receipt is on version 1.0 but the actual release number is 1.6.2 

` pkg-ref id="com.sparta.pkg." version="1.0" auth="Root"` would become  `pkg-ref id="com.sparta.pkg." version="1.6.2" auth="Root"`

Thanks for your consideration, and please let me know if you want any further clarification 

Paul

items.title: None of the plugins will load in Reaper (v.1.6.1 & 1.6.2 – macOS)
items.body: I've had problems with installing v.1.6.1 and just tried installing v.1.6.2 and get the same problem there: None of the plugins load in Reaper. Method to reproduce: - Start Reaper with a new empty project - Create a new track. (I also increased the number of channels on the track to 16) - Click the FX button - Within that window, click Add. From the list in the left panel, I chose `Developer > AALTO`, select all plugins listed and add them all. - Result: All of them have a similar error message to what is displayed above. Next, I tried to load the standalone application found in `/Applications/SPARTA/HOSIRR.app`. This resulted in a crash. I have uploaded the crash log here: https://gist.github.com/lossius/8a4de8ac73789969ca6bbb8798050434 MacBook Pro (q6 inch, 2019) 2,4 GHz 8-Core Intel Core i9 macOS Monterey 12.4 Reaper v6.61 - June 17 2022 Cleaning out all plugins named `sparta_XXX` in `/Library/Audio/Plugins/VST` and then re-installing v. 1.6.0 brings them all back to life. In all cases I have used the `(10.13+, x86-64) - (recommended for Intel CPUs)` installers.

items.title: 6DoFconv: fix tvconv_setTargetPosition() argument order
items.body:
hi,

the 6DoFconv plugin contains two calls to `tvconv_setTargetPosition()` with the `position` and `dim` arguments backwards, causing crashes and/or other incorrect behavior. this patch fixes that.

items.title: Binauralizer is silent
items.body:
Hi.

Thank you for the latest release with a fix for crashes on loading of certain SOFA files.

I have now tested latest Binauralizer on 2 different Windows computers with 2 different hosts and must conclude that: **every time I load a custom HRIR SOFA file there is no sound out of Binauralizer**. These are the [same HRTFs](https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/files/8669881/HRIR_ARI_48000.zip) which previously tended to crash the VST. Now they load nicely, I can see that HRIR is loaded, only no sound comes out.  The default HRTF still works, only the custom SOFA HRIR is silent.


Also minor thing:  the version number on the plugin says "Build Data April 3 2022" which is most likely wrong. 

Best regards,
Sergejs

items.title: Why need to set frame size to multiple of 128?
items.body:
For ambiBIN, is it necessary to require the frame size to be a multiple of 128?

https://github.com/leomccormack/Spatial_Audio_Framework/blob/e32c6ec8f1e87fa6360aa75725b3073d02fef1c4/examples/src/ambi_bin/ambi_bin.c#L408 and https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/blob/b696ecbd9c9323c47b61147e349a3f014afcf57b/audio_plugins/_SPARTA_ambiBIN_/src/PluginProcessor.cpp#L289

![2022-03-02 11_01_41-](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2096055/156432253-ddf45c1f-c896-442a-983d-70798b88f2ce.png)

I'm trying to use the plugin in a real-time environment, and I think it has a fluctuating non-standard block size. If the audio rate is 44100, and the video rate of the environment is 60, then the requested number of samples is 735, and this is not a multiple of 128.

items.title: [SPARTA Panner] if real source channel index exceeds some number, Reaper crashes.
items.body:
When loading a loudspeaker configuration, it appears that there is an upper limit to the channel ID of a non-imaginary speaker (`"Channel"` in the JSON file), beyond which Reaper crashes.

This doesn't seem to be a problem if the speaker is imaginary (i.e. `"IsImaginary": true` in the JSON file).

Example: I have a 76-channel array. 38 are real, 38 imaginary. If the real channels are in the first half of the configuration (channels 1-38), it loads fine. If the real channels are in the second half (channels 38-76), reaper crashes when the config file is loaded.

Narrowing down a bit, I took the breaking case (channels 38-76 are real) and trimmed channels until reaper didn't crash. Real channels up to Channel ID 69 are OK, but breaks at 70. Changing Channel 70 to be imaginary and it works again.

The 4 attached config files illustrate the above cases (GItHub required them to be `.txt` so should be converted back to `.json`).
[ls_config_VBAP_38real_70okIfImaginary.txt](https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/files/7796314/ls_config_VBAP_38real_70okIfImaginary.txt)
[ls_config_VBAP_76ch_secondHalfReal_BREAKS.txt](https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/files/7796316/ls_config_VBAP_76ch_secondHalfReal_BREAKS.txt)
[ls_config_VBAP_76ch_firstHalfReal_OK.txt](https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/files/7796315/ls_config_VBAP_76ch_firstHalfReal_OK.txt)
[ls_config_VBAP_38real_69ok.txt](https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/files/7796312/ls_config_VBAP_38real_69ok.txt)

I'd say the max Channel ID of a real loudspeaker is 69, but that number may just be 'magic', in that it could be somehow related to the total number of channels, number of specified track channels (I'm using 38 or 40), or something specific to this configuration and how the triangulation/inversion is performed in by SAF.

Panner version 1.5.8
Reaper version 6.26

items.title: Plugins built from source segfault few seconds after load on Linux
items.body:
Hi! 

As a way to get around the problems with what seems to be runtime dependencies for old versions of libraries ( https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/issues/42 ). I've started experimenting with compiling the plugins from source in what will eventually end up as a package on Arch Linux.

I've (finally!) managed to compile the plugins but all VST hosts segfault a few seconds after loading any of the plugins.

Here's how I build the plugins:
```bash
cd "$srcdir/$pkgname"

	git submodule update --init --recursive

	# Get VST2 SDK
	./audio_plugins/install-vst2_sdk.sh &&\

	# Build
	mkdir -p build &&\
	cmake -S . -B build \
		-DSAF_ENABLE_SOFA_READER_MODULE=1 \
		-DSAF_PERFORMANCE_LIB=SAF_USE_INTEL_MKL_LP64 \
		-DNETCDF_LIBRARY="/usr/lib/libnetcdf.so" \
		-DINTEL_MKL_HEADER_PATH="/opt/intel/mkl/include" \
		-DINTEL_MKL_LIB="/opt/intel/mkl/lib/intel64/libmkl_rt.so" \
		-DSAF_USE_FFTW=1 \
		-DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX="$pkgdir/usr/lib/vst"
		# -DJUCE_COPY_PLUGIN_AFTER_BUILD=ON \
		# -DSAF_ENABLE_SIMD=1
	cd build
	make

```

And how I install them:
```bash
# Install vst plugins
	for F in $(ls ${srcdir}/${pkgname}/build/audio_plugins/*/sparta*artefacts/Release/VST/*.so); do
		install -Dm755 "$F"  "$pkgdir/usr/lib/vst/$(basename $F)";
	done
```

Any ideas on why the segfaulting is happening here?

items.title: AmbiBIN doesn't keep the SOFA files loaded in the list after closing the UI (Reaper)
items.body:
If I select a sofa HRIR in AmbiBIN, the location of the HRIR file is shown on the top left of the UI in Output. But if I close the plugin UI and open it again, or if I close the project and open it again, the HRIR list is empty and shows "Load SOFA file" instead and "(no recently selectd files)" if I try expand the list.

It can be hard to know then if the SOFA file is loaded or not. Also, the path to the latest SOFA file loaded is not remembered by AmbiBIN, so if you want to load a new file after you have closed the UI or the project, you have to browse to the correct location again.

items.title: HO-DirAC automation not recording in Reaper
items.body:
For some reason it seems that any value changes for the Yaw, Pitch and Roll parameters do not get recorded in the corresponding automation track, even though the automation is set to Write. If I move any of those parameters in the VST's UI, while Reaper is recording automation, nothing gets recorded. This is the same in the case of controlling them using OSC messages (which is what ultimately I'm trying to do).  What's strange is that the automation values in the track header do change (both the red knob and the green number). Additionally, the only way for automation to be written is if I manually move the red knob in the track header (see attached image for reference), doing this also changes the parameter in the plugin. Other plugins are working as expected.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4064498/134074533-3a959749-7fc9-4ca2-8419-a57443a6a915.png)

items.title: Binauralizer interpolation mode for maximum accuracy
items.body:
Hello.
I am trying to use sparta binauralizer with my custom HRTF sofa to monitor multi-channel audio.
Which interpolation mode ("Triangular" or "Triangular PS") is most accurate? 
Given the input 5.1 source I am currently working with, these interpolation options   produce very obvious difference in binauralized output.
I don't know which mode should I trust more.
I am not expert but I guess that "Triangular PS" is less accurate because of some simplification of processing algorythm.
So can someone clarify it for me plz?
Also why we need two modes instead of just one mode with maximum accuracy?

items.title: Powermap plugin: Map Avg and Cov Avg parameters
items.body:
Hi, 
Can you give precisions about what processing is done to average the powermap and the exact influence of Map Avg and Cov. Avg.  I imagine Cov. Avg is related to the length of the frame to estimate the covariance. What's the relation between frame length and parameter value ? 
I guess map average acts as an averaging filter with previous frames but I'm not sure. 

Regards, 

Théophile

items.title: install-juce.sh can't detect JUCE 6 to compile it as GPL
items.body:
## Description

Search path is wrong to find the licensing file of JUCE version 6, when using the install-juce.sh script

## Environment

1. OS: Ubuntu 20.04

## Reproducible Steps

Steps to create the smallest reproducible scenario:
1. Run "audio_plugins/install-juce.sh" to fetch and build JUCE with its Projucer app
2. Start "SDKs/Projucer"
3. Notice that the compiled JUCE version is not GPL

## Expected Output

line 88 of "SDKs/JUCE/extras/Projucer/Source/Application/UserAccount/jucer_LicenseState.h"
should be "Type type = Type::gpl;"

## Actual Output

line 88 of "SDKs/JUCE/extras/Projucer/Source/Application/UserAccount/jucer_LicenseState.h"
is "Type type = Type::none;"

## Additional information

I was too lazy to fork the code again for such a simple fix... Here's a patch:
[install-juce.patch.gz](https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/files/6130211/install-juce.patch.gz)
(BTW I also uploaded this patch to the Spatial_Audio_Framework repo, it was a mistake)

items.title: Building error using openBlas
items.body:
Hi, thanks for the awesome project!
I want to use OpenBlas so I followed the instructions [here](https://github.com/leomccormack/Spatial_Audio_Framework/blob/master/docs/PERFORMANCE_LIBRARY_INSTRUCTIONS.md#saf_use_open_blas_and_lapacke). To run on MAC, I built OpenBlas via CMake. I also added the following lines in `Header Search Paths` in the Projucer.

```
<path>/OpenBLAS/lapack-netlib/CBLAS/include
<path>/OpenBLAS/lapack-netlib/LAPACKE/include
```

But I got this error:

```
Undefined symbol: _LAPACKE_sgetrf
Undefined symbol: _LAPACKE_sgetri
```

How to fix it?

items.title: Magnitude of Velocity vector in AmbiDEC
items.body:
Hi,

I am testing different Ambisonics decoders for a 2D regular quad array of loudspeakers. I measured the MMD decoder in AmbiDEC and I see that the resulting rV magnitude is 1.5 instead of 1. In fact all the decoders other than the AllRAD gave me that magnitude. Could there be a bug somewhere inside the SAF? I know it could also be my measuring method, but I also measured the decoding matrix returned by the PINV method within the [Ambisonics Decoder Toolbox](https://bitbucket.org/ambidecodertoolbox/adt/src/master/) and that one is correct (rV=1). You can try the attached JSON file using IEM's SimpleDecoder.

Thank you very much for the SPARTA Suite!
[quad_1o_adt.json.zip](https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/files/5532809/quad_1o_adt.json.zip)



Regards.

items.title: AmbiBIN OSC messaging not working
items.body: We are trying to get a headtracking sensor to work with version 1.5.0 of SPARTA AmbiBIN, but it seems that the this version has some OSC issues. Version 1.4.2 worked fine but the latest 1.5.0 receives OSC messages only in the Yaw when an array is sent (/ypr). Also, sending OSC messages separately (/yaw, /pitch, /roll) works strange since the roll is received as yaw, the yaw as the pitch and roll gets no data.

items.title: Linux binary compat (gtk, webkit)
items.body:
Currently JUCE dynamically links again in gtk-webit by default.  This does not only produce binaries that may  not be redistributable, but it also results in a dependency on gtk3 (and 20+ indirect dependent libs).

Due to the gtk3 dependency the plugins will not load in Ardour (or Harrison Mixbus).

Please consider adding `JUCE_WEB_BROWSER="0"` to `<JUCEOPTIONS>` in **all** *.jucer files.

e.g replace https://github.com/leomccormack/SPARTA/blob/dfd3becddb30effeb2008b5f874a5c05b8856468/audio_plugins/_SPARTA_ambiDRC_/sparta_ambiDRC.jucer#L347
```
<JUCEOPTIONS JUCE_QUICKTIME="disabled" JUCE_USE_CAMERA="disabled" JUCE_WEB_BROWSER="0"/>
```

items.title: Installing on Arch Linux
items.body:
Hi, sorry I know there's an issue open on linux installation right now, but I thought I'd make a seperate one for installing on Arch Linux (and once this is succesful I will make a package for the aur). 

I managed to install most/all dependencies via yay:

```
yay -S hdf5 libxext lapack libxinerama webkitgtk2-bin netcdf-fortran libcurl-gnutls
```
The only problem now is that it is still complaining about a missing cdff file:
```
swell: dlopen() failed: libnetcdf.so.13: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```
libnetcdf.so.13 is not included in any of the netcdf-fortran packages on Arch as far as I can tell. Any pointers?

items.title: error in linux install instructions
items.body:
hi just noticed a typo in the install instructions for linux:
```
sudo cp saf_mkl_custom.so /usr/lib
```
should be
```
sudo cp libsaf_mkl_custom.so /usr/lib
```

items.title: Installation on Linux
items.body:
Trying to install Linux_SPARTA_2020_02_10_v1.3.4 downloaded from web onto Ubuntu 18.0.4 LTS (64-bit) with Reaper v6.09. Reaper finds the plugins but cam't load them. They all report...

```
swell: dlopen() failed: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libm.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.29' not found (required by /usr/lib/aalto_plugins/sparta_ambiENC.so)
```
I found this issue reported [https://forum.juce.com/t/glibc-2-29-not-found-on-ubuntu-18-04/34960/7](https://forum.juce.com/t/glibc-2-29-not-found-on-ubuntu-18-04/34960/7) which looks relevant. I haven't tried compiling from source myself.

items.title: Using OSC control causes plugin to crash in REAPER
items.body:
I'm trying to send an osc command to the COMPASS Binaural plugin from a C# script. I've implemented the command as follows: "/ypr[-20,30,40]". The numbers are just arbitrary values but every time I try to send the osc command, the plugin causes REAPER to crash. 

I would like to ask if there is something wrong with the syntax that I sent or if there is some other issue.

REAPER also does have its own OSC control, which is defined within REAPER itself. However, it seems that the port that COMPASS uses is not related to the REAPER port, so I did not use REAPER's addressing definitions for OSC for this plugin. I'm not too familiar with OSC itself, but I'm trying to do a unicast from another program to the COMPASS plugin in order to update the ypr values.

items.title: Building question
items.body:
A quick question about this for a linux compile: 

Define one of the following preprocessor definitions, depending on which library/libraries you want to use:

```
SAF_USE_INTEL_MKL
SAF_USE_OPEN_BLAS_AND_LAPACKE
SAF_USE_ATLAS
```
Where should these preprocessor definitions be defined? I get this during compilation
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lsaf_mkl_custom
even though i've installed intel-mkl from the repository.

items.title: Panner.. Is it possible to alter the influence of a speaker?
items.body:
Panner.. Is it possible to alter the influence of a speaker?

i.e in 5.1 you may want the center speaker to only have 50% influence (bleeds). 100% would be normal behaviour. 0% would be ignore that speaker completely (so only nearest left/right would be used).

Thanks.
